moves.1. e4: My opponent was crushing me toward the middle of the game when he saw a chance to snatch a pawn.  The down side was it cost him the game.
moves.1... c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6: Thought I would try I different type of dragon than I'm used to.
moves.6... Bg7 7. f4 Nc6 8. Bb5 Qb6 9. Qd2 Nxe: The c3 knight is forced to guard the b5 bishop leaving the e4 pawn exposed.
moves.10. Bxc6+ bxc6 11. Nxe4 Bxd4: Only way I could find to not lose quickly.
moves.12. c3 Be3 13. Qe2 f6: here my opponent removes the defender of the f4 pawn.
moves.14. Bh4 Bxf4: ?? the queen and knight make a perfect team here.
moves.15. Nxf6+: !! Kd8 Kd5 and black is in Kf8 the best move would loosen the death grip on blacks position giving chances.
moves.15... Kf7: But my opponent decides on Kf7
moves.16. Qc4+: In order to free up the knight, and give threat to f4.
moves.17. Qxf4: exf6 Qxf6+ white looks playable.  Bxf6 looks fine too though Re8+ gives me some concern.
moves.17... Bf5: Going after the knight for keeps.
moves.19... Ke8: ? I don't like this move I though Qxc3 would solidify blacks game a bit.
moves.20... Kxd7: ??? e6 would have given black some chance of continued play but this just ends it.
moves.21. Rxe7+: The game ends in K(rank 8) Qc7#.
